alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:41PM MST until July 31 at 11:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 1145 PM MST. * At 840 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pueblo Colorado Wash and Bidahochi Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
